position.marginalia_text: qui vult ergo proficere in hac sapientia, oportet ista[m] admirabile[m] mixtionem, seu arcanu[m] maximu[m] componere: & postea ip[su]m mutare de natura in natura[m], Luca sic dicente in Turba. Pluribus rebus &e

marginalia.translation: Therefore, the one who wants to succeed in this practical wisdom ought to compose this astonishing mixture or the greatest secret. And afterwards, Lucas says in the Assembly of Philosophers, to change from the nature to the nature. On many more things etc.

position.marginalia_text: Nam vt testatur Geber, Ars talis no[n] co[n]sistit in pluralitate rerum, cum dicit. Est enim lapis vnus, Medecina vna, in q[uo] magisteriu[m] n[ost]r[u]m co[n]sistit.

marginalia.translation: For, as Geber testifies, such an art does not consist of the plurality of things/matters. As he says, for it is one stone, one medicine of which the magisterial matter constists.

position.marginalia_text: In vna ergo re consistit totum magisterium istud: s[cilicet] in Argento vivo: & hoc expresse dicit Alphidius filio suo. Scito fili quod hoc sapis qui est radix, de quo o[mn]es sapientes tractaverunt, Argentu[m] viuum est. Et est quoddam Argentum vinum Albi coloris, & plus quam Speculu[m] splendens. Item fertur in turba. Initium totius operis est Albedo [id est] Argentu[m] vinum. Rubor'q[ue] succedit. Notetis ergo quod Acetum, Agnus, Aibachest, Albedo, Alborach, Albu[m] plumbum, Anima, Aqua albificans, Aqua gravis, Aqua mercurialis, Aqua mundificata, Aqua sicca, Aqua talchi, Aqua viua, Aqua viscosa Aqua vita[e], Aqua vrina[e], Argentum viuum sapientum,

marginalia.translation: Therefore one whole magestrial thing consists of one thing/matter, certainly mercury. And this Alphidius said to his son clearly. Know, my son, that this stone which is the root from which all widom is extracted, is mercury. And there is a certain mercury of white colour, an even much more splendour copy. Likewise it is considered in the Assemlby of Philosophers. The beginning of the entire work is whiteness, that is mercury. And redness follows. Therefore, take not what vinegar, lamb, alkahest, whiteness, , tin, ,
